column2: TN DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Tennessee

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column6: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column8: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

column2: 2. The penalty for a first DUI conviction twill be:
column4: a fine, 48 hours in jail and 1 year revocation.
column8: a $100 fine, 24 hours in jail and 6 months revocation.

column2: 3. If you are not the first at the scene of accident and your help is not needed, you should:
column4: stop and give help.
column6: slow down and ask if any help is needed.
column8: drive on and do not interfere with procedures.

column2: 4. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Call the police.

column2: 5. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.

column2: 6. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 7. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column6: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column8: you are not wearing safety belts.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing

column2: 9. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Always rely on

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Stop and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic
column6: Be prepared to stop if necessary
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 11. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column8: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turn
column8: Do not pass on the left.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: A steep grade is ahead

column2: 15. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 16. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 17. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
column4: helps prevent rear-end collisions.

column2: 18. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: at most intersections.

column2: 19. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column6: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
column8: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.

column2: 20. BAC is:
column4: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Warning

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 23. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 24. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 25. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 26. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: turn off the ignition.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 29. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 30. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: the type of route you are on.
